intro: Silaus tenellus, commonly known as the slender silversword, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy rosette structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments on the island of Maui. Its leaves are narrow and silvery-green, with a dense covering of fine hairs. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, Silaus tenellus is critically threatened, making conservation efforts essential for its survival.
